segment.source: Customize Windows 10 Start with mobile device management (MDM) (Windows 10)
segment.target: Customize Windows 10 Start with mobile device management (MDM) (Windows 10)

segment.source: In Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, you can use a mobile device management (MDM) policy to deploy a customized Start layout to users.
segment.target: In Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, you can use a mobile device management (MDM) policy to deploy a customized Start layout to users.

segment.source: Customize Windows 10 Start with mobile device management (MDM)
segment.target: Customize Windows 10 Start with mobile device management (MDM)

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Looking for consumer information?
segment.target: Looking for consumer information?

segment.source: Customize the Start menu
segment.target: Customize the Start menu

segment.source: In Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, you can use a mobile device management (MDM) policy to deploy a customized Start layout to users.
segment.target: In Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, you can use a mobile device management (MDM) policy to deploy a customized Start layout to users.

segment.source: No reimaging is required, and the Start layout can be updated simply by overwriting the .xml file that contains the layout.
segment.target: No reimaging is required, and the Start layout can be updated simply by overwriting the .xml file that contains the layout.

segment.source: This enables you to customize Start layouts for different departments or organizations, with minimal management overhead.
segment.target: This enables you to customize Start layouts for different departments or organizations, with minimal management overhead.

segment.source: Before you begin: Customize and export Start layout
segment.target: Before you begin: Customize and export Start layout

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: When a full Start layout is applied with this method, the users cannot pin, unpin, or uninstall apps from Start.
segment.target: When a full Start layout is applied with this method, the users cannot pin, unpin, or uninstall apps from Start.

segment.source: Users can view and open all apps in the All Apps view, but they cannot pin any apps to Start.
segment.target: Users can view and open all apps in the All Apps view, but they cannot pin any apps to Start.

segment.source: When a partial Start layout is applied, the contents of the specified tile groups cannot be changed, but users can move those groups, and can also create and customize their own groups.
segment.target: When a partial Start layout is applied, the contents of the specified tile groups cannot be changed, but users can move those groups, and can also create and customize their own groups.

segment.source: How Start layout control works
segment.target: How Start layout control works

segment.source: Two features enable Start layout control:
segment.target: Two features enable Start layout control:

segment.source: The Export-StartLayout cmdlet in Windows PowerShell exports a description of the current Start layout in .xml file format.
segment.target: The Export-StartLayout cmdlet in Windows PowerShell exports a description of the current Start layout in .xml file format.

segment.source: Start layout can only be applied to a device using the same architecture (32-bit or 64-bit) as the device on which Start layout was created.
segment.target: Start layout can only be applied to a device using the same architecture (32-bit or 64-bit) as the device on which Start layout was created.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To import the layout of Start to a mounted Windows image, use the Import-StartLayout cmdlet.
segment.target: To import the layout of Start to a mounted Windows image, use the Import-StartLayout cmdlet.

segment.source: In MDM, you set the path to the .xml file that defines the Start layout using an OMA-URI setting, which is based on the Policy configuration service provider (CSP).
segment.target: In MDM, you set the path to the .xml file that defines the Start layout using an OMA-URI setting, which is based on the Policy configuration service provider (CSP).

segment.source: Create a policy for your customized Start layout
segment.target: Create a policy for your customized Start layout

segment.source: This example uses Microsoft Intune to configure an MDM policy that applies a customized Start layout.
segment.target: This example uses Microsoft Intune to configure an MDM policy that applies a customized Start layout.

segment.source: See the documentation for your MDM solution for help in applying the policy.
segment.target: See the documentation for your MDM solution for help in applying the policy.

segment.source: In the Start layout file created when you ran Export-StartLayout, replace markup characters with escape characters, and save the file.
segment.target: In the Start layout file created when you ran Export-StartLayout, replace markup characters with escape characters, and save the file.

segment.source: (You can replace the characters manually or use an online tool.)
segment.target: (You can replace the characters manually or use an online tool.)

segment.source: Example of a layout file produced by Export-StartLayout:
segment.target: Example of a layout file produced by Export-StartLayout:

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: Example of the same layout file with escape characters replacing the markup characters:
segment.target: Example of the same layout file with escape characters replacing the markup characters:

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click PolicyAdd Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click PolicyAdd Policy.

segment.source: Under Windows, choose a Custom Configuration (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later) policy.
segment.target: Under Windows, choose a Custom Configuration (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later) policy.

segment.source: Enter a name (mandatory) and description (optional) for the policy.
segment.target: Enter a name (mandatory) and description (optional) for the policy.

segment.source: In the OMA-URI Settings section, click Add.
segment.target: In the OMA-URI Settings section, click Add.

segment.source: In Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting, enter the following information.
segment.target: In Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting, enter the following information.

segment.source: Item
segment.target: Item

segment.source: Information
segment.target: Information

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.

segment.source: Setting description
segment.target: Setting description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.

segment.source: Data type
segment.target: Data type

segment.source: String
segment.target: String

segment.source: OMA-URI (case sensitive)
segment.target: OMA-URI (case sensitive)

segment.source: ./User/Vendor/MSFT/Policy/Config/Start/StartLayout
segment.target: ./User/Vendor/MSFT/Policy/Config/Start/StartLayout

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Paste the contents of the Start layout .xml file that you created.
segment.target: Paste the contents of the Start layout .xml file that you created.

segment.source: Click OK to save the setting and return to the Create Policy page.
segment.target: Click OK to save the setting and return to the Create Policy page.

segment.source: Click Save Policy.
segment.target: Click Save Policy.
